## Discussion

A handle’s value corresponds to its type. For example, a handle with [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/type] equal to [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/HandleType/phoneNumber] should have a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/value] consisting of a sequence of digits.

# value

**Instance Property**

The value of the handle.

## Declaration

```swift
var value: String { get }
```

## Discussion

A handle’s value corresponds to its type. For example, a handle with [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/type] equal to [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/HandleType/phoneNumber] should have a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXHandle/value] consisting of a sequence of digits.

## Accessing Handle Attributes

- **type**: The type of the handle.
title: value
